intro: Talamancaster minusculus, commonly known as the dwarf talamancaster, is a small flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
